Behind Gaza's 'yellow line,' Israel's postwar laboratory
byline: By Louis Imbert and Marie Jo Sader
subhed: In the half of the Palestinian enclave kept under Israeli army control, several hundred members of anti-Hamas militias and criminal gangs have been brought together. Israeli authorities intend to rely on these groups to counter the Islamist movement.

The European Commission unveils plan to continue financial support for Ukraine after US aid ends
byline: By Virginie Malingre (Brussels, Europe bureau) and Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau)
subhed: The European Commission is considering two mechanisms: a reparations loan funded by immobilized Russian central bank assets held in Europe, or a joint debt guaranteed by the EU budget. The proposals, which face opposition from Belgium and Hungary, will be on the European Council's meeting agenda on December 18 and 19.

title: Algerian court upholds French journalist's seven-year prison sentence
byline: By Brice Laemle, Simon Roger and Hamid Nasri
subhed: Sports journalist Christophe Gleizes has been detained in Algeria since 2024, accused of 'glorifying terrorism.' The ruling dashed hopes raised by a recent diplomatic thaw and leaves a presidential pardon as his last path to release.

title: 'Mektoub, My Love: Canto Due': Abdellatif Kechiche's Mediterranean gem
subhed: The director of 'Blue Is the Warmest Color' is releasing the final installment of his trilogy set in Sète, weaving a tale of intrigue and burning desire. It is a film of reconciliations and reunions, with characters who never fail to surprise.

title: Negotiating peace: A chaotic art with no established rules
subhed: Donald Trump, casting himself as mediator in the Russia-Ukraine war, has been pushing Kyiv and European leaders to accept his 'peace plan,' drafted with Moscow. His seemingly erratic approach reveals a deeper issue: the absence of any standards governing peace processes.

'Nighttime prohibition': Warsaw city center bans alcohol sales at night
subhed: Nearly 180 municipalities in Poland have already opted to ban the sale of alcohol at night. On November 1, two central districts in Warsaw followed suit. The measure, which was initially intended to apply across the entire capital, has sparked heated debate.

title: The significant trade imbalance between France and China
byline: By Harold Thibault (Shanghai (China) special correspondent) and Jordan Pouille (Beijing (China), correspondent)
subhed: Even as Chinese competition increasingly undermines French industries, including in innovation, many French companies argue that maintaining a presence in China remains essential. President Emmanuel Macron is visiting the country from December 3 to 5.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio and Paul Thomas Anderson: Two Hollywood stars in Paris after the battle
subhed: Absent during the European promotion of the film 'One Battle After Another,' the American actor and director reunited in France to talk about Hollywood and their 30-year friendship.
